item.description:
** UPDATE **

changed initial meeting time to 1pm. of course, you can show up whenever you like, but i'll be in the lobby between 1:00 and 1:15 to meet with anyone who comes at that time. you can also contact me (ben) on my phone at any point: 203-554-5144. i'll probably stay until closing (5pm) and then seek sustenance with anyone who cares to join me.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

no, not like that!! that's @#&%$* sick! get your mind out of the gutter! i'm talking about a visit to the Maritime Aquarium in Norwalk. it's hard to believe that the place has been around for almost 20 years. i can vividly remember going there many times as a kid...with my family, on school field trips, etc. good memories. anyway, it's been a while now since i've paid the place a visit, and i'm ready to go back. i hope you'll join me. it's the day before "earth day", so when better? (on earth day itself the place will be a zoo...haha).

the aquarium contains a diverse variety of wildlife that can be found in and around long island sound. exhibits include an indoor/outdoor pool with harbor seals, a river otter habitat, a 110,000 gallon open ocean exhibit with sand tiger sharks as the main attraction, loggerhead sea turtles, a large cylindrical tank full of jellyfish, and for those who can't keep their hands to themselves, various touch tanks full of horseshoe crabs, sea stars, rays, and other bottom-dwelling beasties. there's also a nautical museum and an IMAX theater, which is currently playing "The Human Body", "Whales", and "Ocean Wonderland." for more information on any of this, visit the aquarium's website.

we'll get there around 1pm, which should give us plenty of time to check out the exhibits, maybe take in an IMAX show, and get lunch or a snack in the cafeteria there (the aquarium closes at 5pm). there's also the possibility of getting dinner and/or drinks in SONO afterward, and making a whole day/evening of it. if anyone has any suggestions, put them in your rsvp. if the weather is nice, maybe a place with a patio/outdoor dining area.

i'll probably take the train in, as the aquarium is only about a 10-15 minute walk from the south norwalk train station. for those who intend to drive, there is a big parking garage right next door. additional details on parking can be found on the aquarium's website.

admission to the aquarium only is $11. there's also the "adventure pass", which gets you the aquarium and one daytime IMAX movie for $16.50.

your contact for this event: ben (203) 554-5144
item.name: Sat. 4/21 - The NHC Does Animals! Part I
